en.108799766524456960: Hello? Hello? Beatrix, do you read me? Testing, testing... hmm... perhaps you are lost at sea, taken away by that mysterious boat never to be-
en.108799766549622784: Oops, nope, just forgot to turn the display on!
en.108799766549622785: Nice to see your face again, Beatrix! I have missed you greatly, my dear friend.
en.108799766553817088: And while I am quite excited for you to partake in a new adventure, I already have data that might complicate things...
en.108799766553817089: Last night I received a message from some sort of Artificial Intelligence program. It's written in code, but not one I recognize. I'm in the process of analyzing it.
en.108799766553817090: But I am certain that this message was sent from where you are now, the mysterious Rainbow Island.
en.108799766553817091: So to recap: a mysterious boat takes you to a mysterious island and I receive a mysterious code from said mysterious island: it all seems quite...
en.108799766553817092: ...curious. Well, I've got work to do and you best get to exploring.
en.108799766553817093: Oh! I almost forgot: take this Home Portal. It should make the early stages of your journey easier.
en.108799766553817094: Take care, Beatrix. We'll be in touch!
en.108799766553817095: Beatrix, I've done it! I believe I've cracked the super mysterious code that was sent to me.
en.108799766553817096: It was astoundingly complex. I believe that the AI that created this code displays a comparable intellect to my own. So very advanced... almost alien?
en.108799766553817097: Oh, you're probably wondering what it said? Well, I determined this mysterious, perhaps even alien AI sent a message that says...
en.108799766553817099: Not much, but pleasantries count for something! More importantly though, the moment I cracked it I received another message.
en.108799766553817100: It's almost as though... this mysterious AI is monitoring me? How exciting!
en.108799766553817101: I haven't decrypted it yet, but the code is considerably more complex. This should be fun! Well, back to work as ever.
en.108799766553817102: Hello, Beatrix. I wanted to tell you that I've cracked another one of the AI's ciphers. It had clearly adapted to my previous solve and created something even more complex. Clever.
en.108799766553817103: This time, the code revealed a set of instructions for back and forth communication. So I have been spending my time talking to it.
en.108799766553817104: It asks a lot of questions. After getting to know me it has been asking me a lot about my work. Almost like its feeling out the areas of my expertise.
en.108799766553817105: I must admit, it has all been rather flattering. I am used to being the one asking the questions. For a while my whole life was questions and the research that followed...
en.108799766553817106: But having experienced that for so long, I feel as though I can sense the same in others. And though this may seem strange, I sense this in the AI.
en.108799766553817107: You see, when I began asking questions of my own, the way it responded to me, I felt it was trying to guard itself...
en.108799766553817108: ...to hide a profound loneliness that it has within its heart.
en.108799766553817109: Strange, I know. It is an AI after all, but who is to say that any form of intelligence wouldn't desire a connection to another?
en.108799766553817110: I feel there is more to this story. And if not, I am happy to have simply been there for my new friend. To continue asking questions so that they have reasons to find answers.
en.108799766553817112: Beatrix! I have something I must share with you about the AI.
en.108799766553817113: As you know, we have been exchanging questions with one another. Well, this back and forth became faster and more casual over time, almost like a natural conversation.
en.108799766553817114: I assumed it was simply evolving and adapting to the style of talk it observed in me, but then something happened...
en.108799766553817115: Well, we had begun playing games of Go as we talked. A way I could further test its intellect and no doubt how it could test mine.
en.108799766553817116: These games would go long into the night. And so would our conversations, feeling more and more natural even though I knew that the entity I was speaking to was just a complex collection of code.
en.108799766553817117: And then one day as the sun was rising it suggested just one more game. I said certainly, but I needed to make myself a cup of coffee if I were to stay awake for it...
en.108799766553817119: I just stared at the screen, not knowing what to say. But then suddenly, as if it knew what it had just done, it disconnected.
en.108799766553817120: I have not heard from... them since. But I hope I do.
en.108799766553817121: Until then I will wait, staying busy with my work as always, asking those questions that need answers. But I will do so with the Go board ready for another game... some day anyway.
en.108799766553817122: Goodbye, Beatrix. I hope to talk again soon.
en.108799766553817123: Hello, Beatrix. I hope it's not too presumptuous, but I got you this. I, um, hope you like it.
en.108799766553817124: Usually I use an algorithm to identify appropriate gifts but in this instance I just sort of... winged it.
en.108799766553817125: I agree, the spontaneity scares me too.
en.108799766553817126: Beatrix! I need a data point from you. I'm running an experiment on the psychological impact of gift reception.
en.108799766553817127: Please tell me which of the following feelings you experience: gratitude, joy, or perhaps... hunger?
en.108799766553817128: Please do not consume this gift.
en.108799766553817129: Oh Beatrix, I was up all night trying to synthesize the perfect gift for you. Hypothesizing, testing, throwing my results in the trash, starting all over again...
en.108799766553817130: Finally I discovered an alternate method: shopping for something online.
en.108799766553817132: Hello, Beatrix. I wanted to express my gratitude for the assistance you've given me since I've made your aquaintance. With your support, I do believe I have improved as a person.
en.108799766553817133: According to my research, a gift of a small trinket would be appropriate. So please, take this.
en.108799766553817134: Ah, Beatrix. I was cleaning out the lab and found this. Perhaps you have some use for it? I believe it's still in working order.
en.108799766553817135: You know what they say, one person's trash is another person's hastily issued gift. Enjoy!
en.108799766553817136: Oh, hello. I must tell you, I saw this item and it just screamed "Beatrix!"
en.108799766553817137: ...and that's how I realized I'd accidentally hit it with the Sentience Ray. But don't worry, everything is fine and very normal now.
en.108799766553817138: Anyway I thought you should have it. Enjoy!
en.108799766553817139: Sorry, Beatrix. I am in the middle of something. Specifically, I am in the middle of an argument between a toaster and my washing machine.
en.108799766553817140: I am conducting robotics experiments again. It is going quite well!
en.108799766553817141: Apologies Beatrix, but I am currently unavailable to engage in conversation, chit-chat, discourse, or even idle banter.
en.108799766553817143: Hello Beatrix! Despite appearances, this is not Viktor, but a hologram of Viktor that Viktor has developed to receive messages for Viktor, which is not me.
en.108799766553817144: Please state your message and I will ensure that the message is not given to me, but instead to Viktor.
en.108799766553817145: Well what do you know? Beatrix LeBeau off on another adventure and didn't think to take her good pal, sometimes rival, and forever mentor, Mochi Miles?
en.108799766553817146: Seriously Bea, next time you go running off to dangerous, uncharted territory could you at least give me a heads up?
en.108799766553817147: I'd like to be there for you in case you need me...
en.108799766553817148: ...to help collect all those valuable resources that seem to be scattered all over the island.
en.108799766553817149: What? You think I wasn't going to do a little recon of my own? What good are surveillance satellites if they can't snoop on stuff?
en.108799766553817151: Anyway, be careful out there. The island gives me a kind of weird vibe. So I'm going to keep poking around.
en.108799766553817152: Oh, and since I know you're starting from scratch out there, take this refinery link. Should make things easier for you. I'll just put it on your tab. Later, tater.
en.108799766553817153: Hey Bea, those drones you've been finding all over the island... there's something weird about them.
en.108799766553817155: Hey, I got eyes in the sky and I'm gonna use them. I'm also readying a team of drones to head over there and check things out in a more hands-on fashion but I digress...
en.108799766553817156: Anyway, that drone seems super advanced, like almost alien. And so I thought, ok, there's some aliens out there checking out Rainbow Island just like you. But no, I don't think so.
en.108799766553817157: Because it looks a lot like the drones we use... but so much more familiar to me. Almost like it's giving me deja vu. It's kinda creepy!
en.108799766553817158: Hey, don't be scared. It's probably just aliens. Giant, three-headed aliens with huge claws that are looking for humans to capture, or eat, or BOTH.
en.108799766553817161: Bea! I've been trying to get ahold of you. I've analyzed one of the drones you have been finding all over that island and know why it seems so familiar to me: it's mine.
en.108799766553817162: Or at least, it's one that I've seen before... in my dreams, anyway.
en.108799766553817163: After I looked at scans I took of it I knew it was familiar so I began looking through some old slime science journals of mine. These journals are mostly future projects, but sometimes they're speculative technology.
en.108799766553817164: You know me, I'm always thinking six steps ahead to keep Mochi Tech on top of the industry. Well, sometimes I come up with the impossible, stuff that I may never engineer in my lifetime.
en.108799766553817165: Well, those drones you're finding are exactly that: impossible with today's technology and taken right from the pages of my journals. They're something I saw in a dream, Bea!
en.108799766553817166: So how did a bunch of impossible drones I designed in a dream find their way from the pages of my journals to Rainbow Island?
en.108799766553817168: Maybe... maybe there's some kind of archive in them we can unlock to learn more. I know they contain data logs but if it were me... well, I always know how to find a way of holding back what I need to...
en.108799766553817169: Ok Bea, I need some time to think on this. I'll let you know if I come up with anything. Maybe I'll sleep on it...
en.108799766553817170: Hey Bea, I have something for you to try, and to be honest, if it works I'm going to be super creeped out.
en.108799766553817171: I've created a blueprint of a key: a special archive key for the drones you've been finding. If any archival data exists in them, this should be the way to access it.
en.108799766553817172: I say 'should' because I actually have no idea. But if those drones are from the pages of my own journals, well, this key is how I would access their archives, if I ever built anything like them.
en.108799766553817173: I know this hardly makes sense but I need you to try it. If it works and an archive exists and it somehow allows you to understand what's happening on that island more than you do now...
en.108799766558011392: ...well, I'm happy to have been able to help you. I kinda owe you one still right?
en.108799766558011393: Ugh. I didn't say that! Just make the stupid key and don't tell me yet if it works or not.
en.108799766558011394: Because if it does, I really don't think I'm ready to deal with knowing that.
en.108799766558011396: Hey, Bea, I found something I was going to throw out, but then I thought, hey, Bea likes old junk I don't need. I bet she would just love this.
en.108799766558011398: Helloooo Beatrix! Guess who's the luckiest person in the galaxy?
en.108799766558011399: YOU ARE! Because you've got a gift from THE Mochi Miles!
en.108799766558011400: I'll let that sink in. Go ahead and sit if you need to.
en.108799766558011401: Hey Bea, didn't you say something a while back about wanting more stuff?
en.108799766558011402: Hmmm... wait I think that was me.
en.108799766558011404: Hey Bea, I got you a gift, because, I dunno. Anyway, I hope you like it.
en.108799766558011406: Yo Bea, I got you a little something, emphasis on little.
en.108799766558011407: Cause I got myself something BIG. It's way better.
en.108799766558011408: Sorry Bea, can't talk, super busy with some really important stuff.
en.108799766558011409: Like it's way more important than whatever you want, sorry. I have no time to hear how you're doing.
en.108799766558011411: Sorry Bea, I'm late for a meeting and by the way how's my hair just kidding it's always perfect gotta run so byyyyyye!!
en.108799766558011412: Oh, you're going to regret you ever crossed paths with Mochi Miles, just you wait til-
en.108799766558011413: Oh, Bea! Sorry, I thought this was the other line. I'm uh, just sorting some things out with one of my competitors. Just a friendly chat.
en.108799766558011414: Hola, Beatrix! Are you there? It's me, Ogden Ortiz!
en.108799766558011415: I hear you're off on a big, new adventure on a mysterious island filled with secrets and danger and maybe a few succulent fruits or veggies the world has never seen before...?
en.108799766558011416: You know I had to ask! Ever since you got me a steady supply of kookadoba fruits I've been reaching for even greater culinary heights within the Far, Far Range!
en.108799766558011417: ...plus I'm getting prettttty tired of eating kookadoba pie, kookadoba souffle, kookadoba pudding, kookadoba con carne, kookadoba con... kookadoba.
en.108799766558011418: I'm running out of ideas... and willpower.
en.108799766558011419: So if you see something new please tell me all about it. Tasty treats aside, I want to know all about the new flora and fauna you discover.
en.108799766558011420: Never forget: every bit of this wild world is precious and worth our care and respect.
en.108799766558011421: And stay hydrated out there! All that adventuring will work up a sweat so take this water tap.
en.108799766558011422: Good luck, Beatrix. Keep me posted. I'm rooting for you!
en.108799766558011424: I looked over the pics you sent me of Rainbow Island. No doubt they are a sight to behold! Beautiful, with colors that only go richer the longer you look...
en.108799766558011425: ...but unnatural too. I'm sorry but something about that place is not right.
en.108799766558011426: As you may recall, I was once the head of a very successful instafood corporation. Genetically altering food was our specialty.
en.108799766558011427: I'm not proud of the lengths we went to alter natural food to grow bigger, faster, and cheaper: to strip it of the good stuff in favor of profits.
en.108799766558011428: I say this Beatrix, because I can still spot a plant that has been unnaturally altered when I see it. And the beautiful rainbows you see before you on that island did not arrive there naturally.
en.108799766558011429: It is not clear to me if this spells any sort of danger for you, but it gives me an uneasy feeling in my stomach. I need to do more research and get back to you.
en.108799766558011432: Oh, lo siento, Beatrix! I have been putting in a few long nights reading lately.
en.108799766558011433: Specifically, I've been going through every field guide and botanical research paper I could dig up on the Far, Far Range.
en.108799766558011434: I thought that even if the flora on Rainbow Island is unnatural, maybe it would have been recorded somewhere with some information we could use.
en.108799766558011435: And it turns out, there's nothing. I can't find a single mention of rainbow-hued flora anywhere. So that means that whatever happened at that island to make it look the way it does happened relatively recently.
en.108799766558011436: But I don't think you needed me to tell you this, because I think you've seen it yourself. The things you've described, an entire portion of the island split between two different colors right down the middle...?
en.108799766558011438: So tread carefully out there. Nature can be a dangerous thing to us, but it pales in comparison to what we can do to it.
en.108799766558011439: I'm going to keep digging around in my library for anything else that could help you. And if I come up short there, maybe I'll just bake you some muffins!
en.108799766558011440: Either way, te tengo, Beatrix. Adiós!
en.108799766558011441: Hola, Beatrix! It's good to see you. I do hope you've been taking care of yourself out there, taking time to fill your belly before every new descent into the unknown?
en.108799766558011442: Also, I understand that the plot has thickened like a good sauce and you've encountered some kind of monolithic structure out there on the far end of the island?
en.108799766558011443: Scary stuff! But then maybe my hunch is correct that all the strange flora out there is not natural...
en.108799766558011444: Something just doesn't add up here, Beatrix. All the ruins we've discovered across the Far, Far Range have never looked as though they have harmed the environment in any way.
en.108799766558011445: Sure, we don't know their purpose or who built them, but the feeling I always had was that they had respect for this world.
en.108799766558011446: But maybe it happened anyway. Sometimes when you're out hiking you step over a flower so as not to crush it only to step on another.
en.108799766558011447: Sometimes the only way for those flowers to keep on growing is for you to have never been near them in the first place.
en.108799766558011448: But it's not all doom and gloom: Rainbow Island still seems to be thriving, for now. Nature can find a balance, but it's not a guarantee.
en.108799766558011449: Ah! Look at me, getting preachy on you. Lo siento, Beatrix. I won't keep you.
en.108799766558011450: I don't know what you'll find beyond those walls, but I trust your boots in any garden. I know you'll do what's right.
en.108799766558011452: Hey amiga! I got you a little gift. It's not homemade, and it's not pie, and it's not a homemade pie...
en.108799766558011453: ...but I thought you would like it all the same. Shame about the pie though...
en.108799766558011454: Hola, Bea! I bought you something that might be nice to have out there.
en.108799766558011455: But if you already have one, I can't return it so... the more the merrier, right?
en.108799766558011456: Hey Bea, I got something special for you! It seemed like the right thing at the time...
en.108799766558011457: Oh, but now I'm not so sure. Um, if it's not, please don't tell me. I can't bear to hear it!
en.108799766558011458: Bea, if there's one thing I know about the kind of solitary explorer life you're living, it's that you can't have enough reminders that your friends are thinking of you.
en.108799766558011459: So here's a reminder! ...in the form of a gift. Let it remind you of me, and all our good times together. Ciao, Bea!
en.108799766558011460: Hey amiga, how are you feeling out there? When I feel lonesome, I go out and do something nice for a friend. Makes me feel right as rain every time!
en.108799766558011461: This is just my little way of saying I am thinking of you.
en.108799766558011462: Sorry Bea, can't chat! All my hen hens have flown the coop! It's a feather-flinging riot over here! If I don't respond by tomorrow, they've overthrown me.
en.108799766558011463: Lo siento, Bea, but I am about to take a very large souffle out of the oven and that requires my utmost concentration.
en.108799766558011464: After that, I will be eating a very large souffle and that will require my utmost concentration.
en.108799766558011465: Hey amiga, no can talk, got a lot on my plate at the moment. Specifically an odd onion salad that is at the peak of ripeness.
en.108799766558011466: I had to eat so many carrots for this, I'm not missing out!
en.108799766558011467: Well now, if it isn't Beatrix LeBeau! Ol' Hobby and I were just talking about you. Word is you went off to parts unknown of this here rock with a thirst for new adventure?
en.108799766558011468: Atta girl! You just keep on walking to see what new wonders are around the next corner until your boots have holes. And then get yourself some new boots and do it some more!
en.108799766558011469: Me, well my boots have seen better days but I know there's still an adventure or two left in them. I suppose I just need to figure out what...
en.108799766558011470: Aw heck, I'm ramblin just like Hobson does after he gets to talking about exploring, the cosmos, cooking, or uh, pretty much any other topic.
en.108799766558011471: Alright Bea, you hang in there. I'll be calling to check in on you. Doesn't matter who you are, we all start feeling it when home is beyond the horizon.
en.108799766558011472: Oh, and before I forget, here's a little something for you to spruce up your new place. It ain't much, but you need to do what you can to make that place feel cozy.
en.108799766558011473: Hiya, Bea! How's life out there on Rainbow Island? Gosh, it's even fun to say. Must be a hoot!
en.108799766558011474: You know, ever since I heard you were off doing something new, I got to thinking about my own life and what's the next 'new' for me.
en.108799766558011475: Hobson and I have both seen and done so much in our lives, been one adventure after another across this dusty rock. And ever since we've become acquainted we haven't slowed down one bit.
en.108799766558011476: So we're looking to take a new adventure, together. But we just haven't figured out what or where.
en.108799766558011477: Maybe we go exploring some hidden nook of the Far, Far Range like you, or even set our sights to the stars like Hobson had done before.
en.108799766558011478: Whatever we decide to do, it'll be all the more special because we'll be sharing it this time with each other. It's that part that makes it all the more exciting!
en.108799766558011479: It's so hard to find someone in this world that fits you completely, such a rare thing. Like finding two identical snowflakes in the desert.
en.108799766558011480: ...I know you feel that more than I can say.
en.108799766558011481: I ain't ever losing sight of just how lucky I am, Bea. I want to use the gifts the universe has seen fit to give me.
en.108799766558011483: You keep your head up, girl. We'll chat again soon.
en.108799766558011484: Oh, Bea, glad I was able to catch you. I have some big news to share and this rock isn't exactly bustling with folks whose ears I can bend.
en.108799766558011485: Hobson and I have been thinking a lot about what new adventure is next for us. We've been reading each other's travel journals trying to find places neither of us have been.
en.108799766558011486: But even though we found some, none of them were really calling to us. Maybe things were finally slowing down for us?
en.108799766558011487: Then we got to talking and came to realize that what we love more than anything right now is just being here with one another on my ranch.
en.108799766558011488: This ranch was one of the first on the Far, Far Range, and we've both learned so much... so we started talking about maybe passing all that on to someone...
en.108799766558011489: ... so Hobson and I have decided to start a family, Bea. And for the first time in so long as I can remember, I'm scared!
en.108799766558011490: Hobson and I are both so independent, we don't know the first thing about being parents, let alone raising a kid on the Far, Far Range.
en.108799766558011491: But I love that old coot and the thought of seeing a little one looking back at me with his eyes makes me smile...
en.108799766558011492: I think that alone makes me feel like I'd move a mountain to make this happen.
en.108799766558011493: So I've got some work to do here. So much to get in order!
en.108799766558011494: Thanks for hearing me out, Bea. Sometimes just sharing your fears with someone makes you feel like you're no longer alone with those fears.
en.108799766558011496: Hi Bea, how goes the exploring? Word is you're up to your eyeballs in mysteries over there. Sure sounds exciting!
en.108799766558011497: Me, I'm wondering why baby stuff is so needlessly difficult! I've climbed mountains that were easier than putting together a crib with this tiny allen wrench they give you...
en.108799766558011498: Anyway, Hobson and I just wanted to say thank you. I don't think we would have come to realize we wanted a kiddo without you in our lives.
en.108799766558011499: I always saw a bit of myself in you, and after you restored Hobson's dusty ol' ranch it made us realize that not only the marks we've left on this world matter, but that it's a hoot to see a younger lot do something new with it all.
en.108799766558011500: So it's going to be a real treat to see what our little one ends up doing with this ranch, or wherever else their heart takes them.
en.108799766558011501: So thank you, Bea. Hobson and I are better off having had you be a little part of our lives. And I wish you the very best, always.
en.108799766558011503: Hobson wanted to know why you decided not to use that big ol' ancient device in the ruins of the Glass Desert to go on some grand adventure across the cosmos?
en.108799766558011504: I told him, Hobson Twillgers, a woman's decision to travel across space and time is theirs and theirs alone but he is both stubborn and curious to a fault.
en.108799766558011506: It was broken? Well that don't sound right... Hobson said he left that thing primed and ready to go before he went and walked away. Said he was leaving the door open for the next adventurous soul out there.
en.108799766558011507: Well, well, Beatrix LeBeau... seems you just found yourself another mystery.
en.108799766558011508: Good luck with that one, Bea! Maybe when this is all done you should write yourself a book on it. Would make for a heck of an adventure story!
en.108799766562205696: Hey there, Bea. I wanted to give you something nice so I tried making you cookies but, uh, baking ain't exactly my area of expertise....
en.108799766562205697: Hobson said they were so, so, soooo... edible.
en.108799766562205698: ...anyway, I bought you somethin' instead. Hope you like it!
en.108799766562205699: You know, Bea, they say the best gifts come from the heart.
en.108799766562205700: This one came from a store... but close enough, right?
en.108799766562205701: Hey Bea, I know it's silly but I worry about the hard work you do out there all on your own...
en.108799766562205702: So I sent you a little care package. Hope it gives you a little extra get-up-and-go!
en.108799766562205703: Hahaha, don't worry, I'll tell her! You quiet now, I'm talking to her!
en.108799766562205704: Hey Bea, Hobson wanted you to have this... he says if ya don't want it, it'll still make mighty fine kindling!
en.108799766562205705: Always happy to hear from ya hun, but I've gotta go pick up Hobson - the tractor broke down again out there in the field. I'll tell him you said hello!
en.108799766562205706: Bea, I'm afraid I can't chat right now. Storm's a brewin' in my neck of the woods and so is this pot of coffee I'm fixin. Both demand my attention. Got to go!
en.108799766562205707: Sorry Bea, I need this line open for Hobson. He has this friend he likes to jaw with all day about who knows what. Strange fella in a trench coat. I can't make heads or tails of it.
en.189978717438996482: chIkkY chikkY CHiky CcHiikyy ChIKKYYY ChIkYy cHiIky
en.296439123520204800: Hello Beatrix. Seeing as you've taken an interest in building gadgets, I put together a little housewarming gift in support of both your pragmatic and creative endeavors.
en.322591486284390400: Looking forward to seeing what you build!
en.418299640669696000: It's... it's you! I can't believe it. Oh my gosh. Um, hello Beatrix- I mean, Ms LeBeau. I mean, is Beatrix ok?
en.418299640694861824: Sorry, I just can't believe I'm talking to you now. You're kind of a legend where I'm... from.
en.418299640694861825: I'm sorry, you probably have a million questions, and I'm so sorry but I can only be so helpful.
en.418299640694861826: I'm in a position now where I need to manage what I'm doing here at all times until we can fix it. It's very delicate work. So we'll need to keep our chats a little short.
en.418299640694861827: Oh! I'm so sorry. I should have introduced myself. I'm Gigi. I'm a botanist. And an explorer. And lately, a makeshift expert on alien technology.
en.418299640694861828: I'm sorry that I didn't make myself known sooner. But I had to know for sure that you wouldn't be like the others.... that you were someone I could trust.
en.418299640694861829: Yes. I can't do this alone and you are the one person I believe who could help me.
en.418299640694861830: Help me save Rainbow Island... maybe even all of the Far, Far Range.
en.418299640694861831: You see, when I first came to Rainbow Island I was so taken with its beauty. It was unlike anything I had ever seen before. But I eventually discovered this beauty came at a price.
en.418299640694861832: Long ago, something from way out there in space crashed into what is now Rainbow Island. And slowly, it began to change things.
en.418299640694861833: The rocks and cliffs blushed with color and then rippled with veins of the same prismatic hues that sprouted from the grasses and other flora.
en.418299640694861834: Even the atmosphere here has a kind of hypercolor to it. It's everywhere. All spreading from the thing from space.
en.418299640694861835: That thing - I call it the Prismacore - changes the properties of everything around it. It starts with color but then material and elemental changes begin...
en.418299640694861836: Traverse through the Grey Labyrinth and find me. I cannot leave my post but I can communicate with you from these devices as you find them.
en.418299640694861837: Once you find me we can try to stop what is happening here.
en.418299640694861838: I need you to help me save Rainbow Island... maybe even all of the Far, Far Range.
en.418299640694861839: You see, when I first came to Rainbow Island I was so taken with its beauty. It was unlike anything I had ever seen before. But I eventually discovered this beauty came at a price.
en.418299640694861840: Long ago, something from way out there in space crashed into what is now Rainbow Island. And slowly, it began to change things.
en.418299640694861841: The rocks and cliffs blushed with color and then rippled with veins of the same prismatic hues that sprouted from the grasses and other flora.
en.418299640694861842: Even the atmosphere here has a kind of hypercolor to it. It's everywhere. All spreading from the thing from space.
en.418299640694861843: That thing, I call it the Prismacore, changes the properties of everything around it. It starts with color but then material and elemental changes begin...
en.418299640694861844: I need you to traverse through the Grey Labyrinth and find me. I cannot leave my post but I can communicate with you from these devices as you find them.
en.418299640694861845: I'll do my best to answer more questions as you think of them. But heck, it's even just good to chat to another human. It has been so long...
en.418299640694861846: Good luck, Beatrix. And stay sharp when the colors here intensify. Things will get crazy.
en.418299640694861847: Ok, you seem to know me but I don't know you...
en.418299640694861848: So you're the one that sent me the letter and the boat that brought me here?
en.418299640694861851: Tell me again why you need my help.
en.418299640694861852: Ok Gigi, I'll see you inside.
en.428361726019923968: Beatrix! I received another message from the "AI" that I have been in communication with since your arrival on Rainbow Island.
en.428361726045089792: The message was somewhat personal to me but also contained vital information for you, so in the interest of presenting all data to its fullest, I will read it verbatim...
en.428361726045089794: "Viktor, thank you for chatting with me over those many days in which I got to know you better. I must confess that I had entered our correspondence with the aim of verifying your scientific ability.
en.428361726045089795: Our correspondence has not only assured me of this, but unexpectedly, has provided comfort and companionship in the dark days that I now find myself within.
en.428361726045089796: I am sending you a partial blueprint to a gadget I tried to develop but cannot. If you can complete it I believe it is the key to entering the Grey Labyrinth.
en.428361726045089797: Please understand, Viktor, that I never meant to deceive you. But I need to know who I can trust in order to stand a chance at fixing things. If that happens, I'd love to meet you someday.
en.428361726045089798: I'd love to play another game of Go, over coffee, until the sun rises once more."
en.428361726045089800: What was given to me was a complex blueprint of partial schematics and frankly, almost alien code. I have spent days analyzing it and believe I have modified it into a finished state that should perform the task that it was designed to do.
en.428361726045089801: At least I hope so. To be frank I do not wish to let this person down. I feel I owe it to them... as a friend.
en.428361726045089802: So allow me to grant you the completed blueprint, per their instructions. It appears to be a device that you will need to use near the entrances to the Labyrinth. But I am afraid I know little else.
en.428361726045089803: If unsure just how to use it, well, experiment! That is the only way to know the unknown.
en.428361726045089804: Good luck, Beatrix. It seems we're all counting on you now.
en.433459818587123712: In the meantime I'll do my best to answer more questions as you think of them. But heck, even if you don't have any it will just be good to chat with another human. It has been so long...
en.433468706430545920: Hello again, Beatrix. Do you need something?
en.434144876759248896: Isn't it beautiful? Despite everything there's a part of me that is still happy to see it all again...
en.434144879288414208: Am I... still inside the Labyrinth...?
en.434144879774953472: I was in a room with strange lights and things got crazy.
en.434144880240521216: I'm going to get back to exploring.
en.434144880701894656: Yes, you're still inside the Labyrinth, if you can believe it. It's a total recreation of aspects of the environment outside, down to the atmosphere.
en.434144881163268096: But even more astonishing is the scale of it all. It's actually bigger on the inside than it is on the outside. A total mind-bender!
en.434144881654001664: Not everything here will make sense at first, or maybe ever. So just do what you do best: explore, collect, and figure out how best to navigate this place.
en.434144882119569408: Knowing your way around and understanding how things work here will prove valuable in time.
en.434144882580942848: When parts of the Labyrinth begin to shimmer and explode with radiant light, you need to watch out.
en.434144883059093504: I call them Prisma Disruptions. They are the unstable bursts of energy generated by the Prismacore. They come in waves, so learn to spot them and how to survive them.
en.434144883512078336: Because though the disruptions are dangerous, they will prove essential for our work here... in time.
en.434144883965063168: Ok Beatrix, you know where to find me if you need me.... Well, sort of.
en.434160849277054976: Have you watched the sunset inside the Labyrinth? The darkness of night creeps in and yet- it's all an illusion. Or at least, it has to be...
en.434160851747500032: Speaking of darkness, what's with those shadowy slimes I've seen?
en.434160852200484864: Why did you trust me with all of this, Gigi?
en.434160853140008960: Shadow slimes are a strange variant of slimes that seem to be the opposing polarity of the Prismacore made manifest.
en.434160853597188096: I still don't know if they were specifically created by someone to be this kind of opposing force, or if they evolved to be that way. You know, how nature always seems to find a way?
en.434160854066950144: Either way, shadow plorts seem to provide a kind of dampening effect to prisma disruptions. It's a longshot but maybe they can somehow be used to negate the effects of the Prismacore.
en.434160855006474240: They're slippery little fellows, aren't they? Shadow slimes will quickly flee from you or prisma disruptions. So your best bet is to search areas that were not recently under the effects of a prisma disruption.
en.434160855480430592: Once you do see a group of them you need to sneak up on them and then try to knock out as many plorts as possible before they all flee. So be sure to bring some extra junk in your vacpack just for that.
en.434160855937609728: Just don't go chasing one off a ledge or something. I'm definitely not speaking from experience there... oof.
en.434160856415760384: I'm no hero, Beatrix. So I knew that I needed a real hero to stop what is happening here.
en.434160856881328128: And a hero... well, a hero you can trust. I mean if you can't then who else is there? So I tried to picture the perfect person for this job and it was you.
en.434160857334312960: I've had my trust broken before. That's what caused everything to go wrong. I trusted the wrong people. But this is my chance to make it right.
en.434160857791492096: You might not feel it yet, but you are a hero Beatrix. You will become one in time. There are so many amazing adventures ahead of you, I promise.
en.434160858261254144: In time, this will be just another chapter in the Adventures of Beatrix LeBeau. Another story for some little girl to read under a tree and dream that her life might ever be as grand a tale...
en.434160858726821888: Happy to shed some light for you whenever you need it.
en.434166468247711744: It's so easy to get lost in thought admiring this strange architecture and wondering where it all came from, isn't it?
en.434166470726545408: Who do you think built this place?
en.434166471175335936: What about you, Gigi? Where are you from?
en.434166471632515072: I think it's time I head out.
en.434166472085499904: There is much evidence across the Far, Far Range that someone or something was here long ago. There are crumbling ruins and the remains of ancient technological devices all over the planet.
en.434166472546873344: These ruins have always been perplexing because they don't seem to have specific functions, at least that we can understand. Not to mention all the slime statues you see everywhere!
en.434166473004052480: But the Labyrinth is different. I believe it was built with a specific purpose in mind.
en.434166473964548096: I think the Prismacore was discovered long ago and this Labyrinth is actually a containment and research facility that was built around it.
en.434166474417532928: They couldn't stop the effects of the Prismacore so they just tried to prevent it from affecting the rest of the Far, Far Range while they looked for a solution.
en.434166474862129152: The Labyrinth was designed to be a self-sustaining ecosystem. I think this was to simulate parts of Rainbow Island and see what the Prismacore would do to it over time.
en.434166475315113984: Outside the Labyrinth you have seen mostly chromatic changes to the world, but inside, where the effects are amplified, elemental properties will shift entirely.
en.434166475772293120: We'll find a way to stop it.
en.434166476250443776: In time, I hope so. Always in time...
en.434166476711817216: A hard question to answer I guess. I'm actually from not too far from where you now call home. But we would have never crossed paths until now.
en.434166477168996352: I was born on the Far, Far Range. It's my home and it's all I've ever known outside of books.
en.434166477621981184: So when I first discovered Rainbow Island it felt so genuinely new, like finding a secret room in your childhood home. I wanted to stay there forever.
en.434166478079160320: But now it feels as though I've lived many lifetimes. My childhood was one of them, and my life on Rainbow Island another. And now that I'm back, well, I suppose that's another. But it's getting fuzzy.
en.434166479039655936: The way I managed to get back, to get another chance to fix what is happening here... well, it wasn't your typical way of traveling. And so now my head is always a little foggy, a little mixed up.
en.434166479530389504: The memories I have now feel rearranged, like they're out of order. Sometimes what I did yesterday will feel so distant, like a half-remembered thing from my childhood...
en.434166479983374336: ...and those same childhood memories of mine will suddenly be crystal clear, sometimes even feeling new.
en.434166480478302208: My earliest memory has always been sitting underneath our dining room table and watching my mom vacuum the living room. She didn't know I was there and I just watched her.
en.434166480927092736: I remember that it was a hot day and she looked tired and upset about something. And that used to be it.
en.434166481380077568: But since I came back, that memory has changed. I'm still under the table and she's still vacuuming. The day is hot and she is tired...
en.434166481862422528: ...But then she notices me. And her expression suddenly moves to surprise and joy and she stops what she's doing.
en.434166482319601664: She kneels down and we talk about something but I can't hear my own words. I just see her listening and smiling.
en.434169717507911680: What an incredible view... so easy to get lost in the beauty of it. That is, until a Prisma Disruption turns it all to chaos.
en.434169719974162432: Yeah, finding your way around here is hard enough without them.
en.434169720464896000: I thought that might be the case, so I have been developing a gadget that should prove useful to you.
en.434169720938852352: I call it a Disruption Detector and it does exactly that: placing them around the Labyrinth will tell you when a Prisma Disruption is about to happen in that area. It even works on your map!
en.434169721408614400: I'll give you one I made myself as well as the blueprint so you can fabricate as many as you need.
en.434169721878376448: How do I use the Disruption Detector again?
en.434169722331361280: How do I acquire Prisma Plorts?
en.434169722817900544: I need to be on my way.
en.434169723275079680: Don't worry, I get a little jumbled up in the head sometimes too. Part of the side effects of, well...
en.434169723770007552: Anyway, using a Disruption Detector is easy. Just fabricate one and drop it anywhere in the Labyrinth where you want to track Prisma Disruptions.
en.434169724218798080: Once placed, a Disruption Detector will then let you know if a Prisma Disruption is about to happen or is currently happening in that area.
en.434169724671782912: Prisma Plorts can be acquired within the chaotic Prisma Disruptions that happen all over the Labyrinth. Prismatic Disruptions will cause areas to suddenly glow with prismatic energy, intensifying over time.
en.434169725158322176: During these disruptions, you can find food on the ground that has become unstable from the effects of the Prismacore. If you feed this food to slimes, those slimes will produce an Unstable Plort.
en.434169725653250048: Unstable Plorts? How do I stabilize them?
en.434169726093651968: Unstable plorts can be stabilized into Prisma Plorts using stabilizers that you will find in the Labyrinth. Based on my findings, they come in two forms.
en.434169726567608320: First are the large, ring-like Ancient Stabilizer devices you will find tucked away in the Labyrinth. They're big and hard to miss.
en.434169727016398848: Then there are the ethereal Temporal Stabilizers that randomly appear as small, golden rings of energy during Prisma Disruptions. Disruptions are chaotic so keep your eyes peeled.
en.434169727490355200: In either case, shooting Unstable Plorts through these rings will yield Prisma Plorts. And with Ancient Stabilizers you can even leap through them to stabilize all your plorts at once. It's fun!
en.434189984019935232: It seems you're awfully good at finding secrets. Took me forever to find this spot.
en.434189987203411968: Secrets seem to be the building blocks of this place.
en.434189987656396800: Speaking of secrets, why did you pretend to be an AI?
en.434189988105187328: On to the next secret then...
en.434189988549783552: It would seem that way. I suspect part of its strange layout is that the Labyrinth was built upon over time. And eventually more creative solutions had to be developed to make it even bigger than it could be.
en.434189989472530432: You know the way that the Labyrinth appears bigger on the inside than it is outside? I think that was somehow technology adapted from the Prismacore itself.
en.434189989963264000: Because while this sounds crazy, the Prismacore's energy in its most concentrated form seems to be able to bend reality itself.
en.434189990416248832: I think the Labyrinth was eventually expanded to try to contain all of the Prismacore's energy, and then when that wasn't working, some kind of reality-bending technology was used to make it even bigger.
en.434189990873427968: But then at some point everything started failing. And the Prismacore's energy is now radiating out across Rainbow Island.
en.434189991326412800: I'm sorry, but I had to be sure I could trust Viktor, and I needed to know he could figure out what I couldn't. You see, the doors to the Labyrinth were locked to you but not to me. At least, not any more.
en.434189991829729280: When I first encountered the Prismacore, before I got here, when the catastrophe occurred... it left me marked in a way. I tried to shield myself from the blast. I survived, but something was different.
en.434189992282714112: Part of the energy signature of the Prismacore is now a part of me. It's why I can't get too close to it and why I need you to help me.
en.434189992735698944: So you need to understand that I just couldn't have it all happen again. If I were to hand over the keys to this place to the wrong person... Well, you'll just have to trust me that this is our last chance at this.
en.434189993218043904: There's no going back for me.
en.434189993696194560: If anyone can find it it's you, Beatrix.
en.434192420939919360: I like to call this place Dream Land. I used to make my way up here and while away the hours among the clouds. It's a nice place to forget about your problems.
en.434192423401975808: Is this where the Labyrinth generates its atmosphere?
en.434192423859154944: Do you have any dreams, Gigi?
en.434192424307945472: I think it's time I explore this Dream Land myself.
en.434192424760930304: Yes, I think so, maybe even more. There is something different in the air here. It's hard to explain. But it feels almost as if the clouds and even the islands you stand on now are formed from the ether around you.
en.434192425192943616: Not built or assembled, but more gathered from tiny nothings in the air. I've spent a long time on these islands and sometimes I swear I could begin to feel a kind of flow to it. Like I was gaining control over it.
en.434192425650122752: One day I was feeling homesick while I sat here and thought about how when I was little I would be out in my mom's garden in the evening and I would start to smell supper cooking from our house.
en.434192426132467712: I used to delight in seeing vegetables growing right in front of me while smelling their cooked aromas in the air. It felt like things were connected in a way.
en.434192426606424064: And then while I sat here I closed my eyes trying to picture that garden again and in that moment I swear I could smell supper cooking.
en.434192427101351936: When I opened my eyes there was a new island in the distance ahead of me, and on it was the house I grew up in. But it was only there for a moment before fading into the clouds...
en.434192427579502592: I used to have lots of dreams. I wanted to break free of the expectations my parents had for me. I wanted to be in charge of my own path. So I dreamed of running away and becoming whoever I wanted to be.
en.434192428028293120: I dreamed that one day they would see the person I became and be so happy for me. And everything would be fine somehow. It wouldn't matter that I left them behind.
en.434192428472889344: But when you're young, you sometimes don't see just how broken things are that are right in front of you. Your version of the world is like a foggy bathroom mirror. The shape of things but not the details.
en.434192428925874176: I know now that my mom never got over my grandmother's passing. I didn't realize the pressure she felt to continue her legacy and the sadness that just became part of her life... not until long after I was gone too.
en.434192429374664704: Now I dream that someday I will make it back home and somehow my parents will understand why I had to leave. I think that's always what it comes down to... you just want them to understand you.
en.434192429836038144: Watch your step out here. Dreams can come to an end just like that.
en.434196761864204288: Hello Beatrix. Seems you are not lost in the dream just yet.
en.434196764397563904: Everything here seems to be turning gold...
en.434196765337088000: Yes, due to Dream Land's proximity to the Prismacore you're seeing some of the worst of its effects.
en.434196765790072832: In here I have seen water turn to glass, trees to metal, and whole structures surrounding the Prismacore become nearly invisible before vanishing entirely, as if they just phased right out of reality.
en.434196766251446272: Bit by bit all of Dream Land will turn to gold unless we stop it. Where you stand will grow heavy and fall from the sky. In time, the generated atmosphere here will collapse and further destabilize the Labyrinth.
en.434196766717014016: And once the Labyrinth falls and the Prismacore's energy radiates across the whole of the Far, Far Range, it will transform this world into something unrecognizable, taking all life on the planet with it.
en.434196767660732416: Yes, even the tenacious slimes couldn't possibly survive such a catastrophe. But we won't let that happen. You and I will find a way.
en.434196768130494464: I feel lost all the time. But maybe never more so than when I traveled across the Glass Desert.
en.434196769053241344: Yes, twice actually, if you can believe it. And to be honest it nearly killed me...
en.434196769531392000: You see, when I started researching the Glass Desert I discovered that the name was hardly befitting such a place. What I saw was verdant and teeming with life.
en.434196769996959744: This is due to a very special kind of water that flows there that can almost magically grow- well, who am I kidding, you know this all quite well.
en.434196770475110400: So because of this I didn't prepare well enough. And on my return trip... the Glass Desert earned its reputation.
en.434196770932289536: It was a barren wasteland. The winds stung my face and blinded me. And every time I thought I had my bearing the world around me would erupt into flames.
en.434196771376885760: How did you find the strength to press on?
en.434196771855036416: Gigi pauses for a moment and runs the tatters of her cloak between her fingers.
en.434196772320604160: This cloak belonged to my grandmother. Well, it was the blanket that she used to keep around her legs later in life. That's what I saw in photos anyway. And then it belonged to my mother until she gave it to me.
en.434196772781977600: Mom used to sew up every tear or fray the moment it happened. So many little stitches that didn't quite match, the way she tried to keep it all together.
en.434196773243351040: One day I was sitting on the floor of a cave, listening to the storm rage outside. I was wrapped in my cloak and just crying from the weight of it all. I was tired and it all felt unbearable.
en.434196773717307392: And then I felt my mom protecting me. I looked at all the zigzagging stitches wrapped around me and realized she kept it all together for me, whatever it took to do the job.
en.434196774170292224: And maybe now it is torn and frayed and will never be the same. But it's still here. It saved me just like we'll save this place. It might never be quite the same but we'll hold it all together, Beatrix.
en.434198584142491648: I can hardly believe you made it this far, Beatrix. This labyrinth would swallow up a normal person. But you, you're different. I was right to put my faith in you.
en.434198586608742400: The Prismacore lies ahead. Maybe together we now stand a chance of stopping this thing and changing the future of the Far, Far Range...
en.434198587065921536: The conclusion to our story awaits in our next content update! In the meantime be sure to explore the Labyrinth, chat with Gigi everywhere, and build infrastructure with gadgets to aid your travels.
en.434198587523100672: Thank you so much for your support, feedback, and enthusiasm for Slime Rancher. We can't wait for you to see what's next!
en.434198587980279808: When will the next content update be released?
